title: This power carries weight beyond convenience. Every rebase decision alters the narrative archaeologists will uncover in future repository digs. Every amended commit rewrites what "really happened" in development history. Dot understands this responsibility, wielding the PATCH TOOL not as hammer but as scalpel, cutting away noise to reveal the signal that was always meant to be. In a system where filesystem is reality and metadata is memory, the tool that edits history edits reality itself.
